ygData.subject: New and Improved
ygData.msgSnippet: He shouldn t be functional, but he is. Still, he looked like a pile of junk.  When Transmutate started to go offline he saw a light.  In this light stood many

He shouldn't be functional, but he is. Still, he looked like a pile of 
junk.  When Transmutate started to go offline he saw a light.  In this 
light stood many transformers.  Unicron, Optimus Prime, many others 
whose names have long been forgotten, others who have not yet gone 
online.  They were all heros from 1 generation or another.  They all 
spoke the same simultanius sentence.
Spirits: Transmutate. Your destiny has not been fulfilled.
He lacked the intellegence to know who they were or understand what 
they meant, but still he did.  Suddenly, he was back in his body, but 
spead throughout the segmeants that had been blown apart.  He waited 
for this destiny to come, but it failed.  His spark no longer had the 
power it once did, he had no power at all.  His body was useless to 
him.

It is stormy (you wanted to incorparate the weather didn't you).  All 
of a sudden a lightening bolt hits his hand.  It comes to life and 
attaches to his arm.  It continues to assemble Transmutate. He starts 
talking when it's finished.

Transmutate: Friend....Sil-ver-bolt.....Ra-vage.

He gets a sad look.  Then he smiles stupidly.

Transmutate:  Find.....Flllllllly.

He flys up in the air.

OOC: Don't start complaining.  Transmutate was in one episonde of the 
series.  He befriended Ravage and Silverbolt, but he hated fighting 
so much that when they started firing at each other he jumped in the 
way of the blast and cancelled it out.  He had enormous power, but no 
way to control it.  When ever he attacked someone his energy just flew 
out in all directions. He was so badly damaged his intellegence was 
barley that of a drone (Rhinox confirmed this), and I have big plans 
for him o.k. and a way to bring up his intellegence.
